44013049	And the Word of יהוה was being spread throughout the entire country .
44013050	But the Yehuḏim stirred up the worshipping and noble women and the chief men of the city , and raised up persecution against Sha’ul and Barnaḇah , and threw them out of their borders .
44013051	And shaking off the dust from their feet against them , they came to Ikonion .
44013052	And the taught ones were filled with joy and the Set-apart Spirit .
44014001	And it came to be in Ikonion that they went together into the congregation of the Yehuḏim , and spoke in such a way that a great number of both Yehuḏim and Greeks believed .
44014002	But the Yehuḏim who would not obey stirred up the gentiles and evilly influenced their beings against the brothers .
44014003	So they remained a long time , speaking boldly in the Master , who was bearing witness to the word of His favour , giving signs and wonders to be done by their hands .
44014004	And the crowd of the city was divided , and some sided with the Yehuḏim , and some with the emissaries .
44014005	But when a move took place by both the gentiles and Yehuḏim , with their rulers , to mistreat and stone them ,
44014006	they became aware of it and fled to Lustra and Derbe , cities of Lukaonia , and the country round about .
44014007	And they were bringing the Good News there .
44014008	And in Lustra there was sitting a certain man , disabled in his feet , a cripple from his mother’s womb , who had never walked .
44014009	This one heard Sha’ul speaking , who , looking intently at him and seeing that he had belief to be healed ,
44014010	said with a loud voice , “ Stand upright on your feet ! ” And he sprang up and began to walk .
44014011	And when the crowds saw what Sha’ul had done , they lifted up their voices , saying in Lukaonian , “ The mighty ones have become like men and come down to us ! ”
44014012	And they called Barnaḇah Zeus , and Sha’ul Hermes , since he was the chief speaker .
44014013	And the priest of Zeus , being in front of their city , brought oxen and wreaths to the gates , and wished to offer with the crowds .
44014014	And when the emissaries Barnaḇah and Sha’ul heard this , they tore their garments and ran in among the crowd , crying out
44014015	and saying , “ Men , why are you doing this ? We also are men with the same nature as you , bringing to you the Good News : to turn from these worthless matters to the living Elohim , who made the heaven , and the earth , and the sea , and all that is in them ,
44014016	who in past generations allowed all the nations to walk in their own ways ,
44014017	though , indeed , He did not leave Himself without witness , doing good – giving us rain from heaven and fruit-bearing seasons , filling our hearts with food and gladness . ”
44014018	Even with these words they still had difficulty in stopping the crowds from offering to them .
44014019	But Yehuḏim arrived from Antioch and Ikonion , and having won over the crowds , they stoned Sha’ul , dragged him out of the city , thinking he was dead .
44014020	But while the taught ones gathered around him , he rose up and went into the city . And on the next day he went away with Barnaḇah to Derbe .
44014021	And having brought the Good News to that city , and having made many taught ones , they returned to Lustra , and Ikonion , and Antioch ,
44014022	strengthening the beings of the taught ones , encouraging them to continue in the belief , and that through many pressures we have to enter the reign of Elohim .
44014023	And having appointed elders in every assembly , having prayed with fasting , they committed them to the Master in whom they had believed .
44014024	And having passed through Pisidia , they came to Pamphulia .
44014025	And having spoken the word in Perge , they went down to Attaleia ,
44014026	and from there they sailed to Antioch , where they had been committed to the favour of Elohim for the work which they had completed .
44014027	And having arrived , and having gathered together the assembly , they related all that Elohim had done with them , and that He had opened the door of belief to the gentiles .
44014028	And they remained there a long time with the taught ones .
44015001	And certain men came down from Yehuḏah and were teaching the brothers , “ Unless you are circumcised , according to the practice of Mosheh , you are unable to be saved . ”
44015002	So when Sha’ul and Barnaḇah had no small dissension and dispute with them , they arranged for Sha’ul and Barnaḇah and certain others of them to go up to Yerushalayim , to the emissaries and elders , about this question .
44015003	So , being sent on their way by the assembly , they passed through Phoenicia and Shomeron , relating the conversion of the gentiles . And they were causing great joy to all the brothers .
44015004	And having arrived in Yerushalayim , they were received by the assembly and the emissaries and the elders . And they reported all that Elohim had done with them .
44015005	And some of the believers who belonged to the sect of the Pharisees , rose up , saying , “ It is necessary to circumcise them , and to command them to keep the Torah of Mosheh . ”
44015006	And the emissaries and elders came together to look into this matter .
44015007	And when there had been much dispute , Kĕpha rose up and said to them , “ Men , brothers , you know that a good while ago Elohim chose among us , that by my mouth the gentiles should hear the word of the Good News and believe .
44015008	“ And Elohim , who knows the heart , bore witness to them , by giving them the Set-apart Spirit , as also to us ,
44015009	and made no distinction between us and them , cleansing their hearts by belief .
44015010	“ Now then , why do you try Elohim by putting a yoke on the neck of the taught ones which neither our fathers nor we were able to bear ?
44015011	“ But through the favour of the Master יהושע Messiah we trust to be saved , in the same way as they . ”
44015012	And all the crowd was silent and were listening to Barnaḇah and Sha’ul declaring how many miracles and wonders Elohim did among the gentiles , through them .
44015013	And after they were silent , Ya‛aqoḇ answered , saying , “ Men , brothers , listen to me :
44015014	“ Shim‛on has declared how Elohim first visited the gentiles to take out of them a people for His Name .
44015015	“ And the words of the prophets agree with this , as it has been written :
44015016	‘ After this I shall return and rebuild the Booth of Dawiḏ which has fallen down . And I shall rebuild its ruins , and I shall set it up ,
44015017	so that the remnant of mankind shall seek יהוה , even all the gentiles on whom My Name has been called , says יהוה who is doing all this , ’
44015018	who has made this known from of old .
44015019	“ Therefore I judge that we should not trouble those from among the gentiles who are turning to Elohim ,
44015020	but that we write to them to abstain from the defilements of idols , and from whoring , and from what is strangled , and from blood .
44015021	“ For from ancient generations Mosheh has , in every city , those proclaiming him – being read in the congregations every Sabbath . ”
44015022	Then it seemed good to the emissaries and elders , with all the assembly , to send chosen men from among them to Antioch with Sha’ul and Barnaḇah : Yehuḏah being called Barsabba , and Sila , leading men among the brothers ,
44015023	having written by their hand this : The emissaries and the elders and the brothers , To the brothers who are of the gentiles in Antioch , and Syria , and Kilikia : Greetings .
44015024	Since we have heard that some who went out from us have troubled you with words , unsettling your lives , to whom we gave no command –
44015025	it seemed good to us , having become of one mind , to send chosen men to you with our beloved Barnaḇah and Sha’ul ,
44015026	men who have given up their lives for the Name of our Master יהושע Messiah .
44015027	We have therefore sent Yehuḏah and Sila , who are also confirming this by word of mouth .
44015028	For it seemed good to the Set-apart Spirit , and to us , to lay upon you no greater burden than these necessities :
44015029	that you abstain from what is offered to idols , and blood , and what is strangled , and whoring . If you keep yourselves from these , you shall do well . Be strong !
44015030	They , therefore , being sent off , went to Antioch . And having gathered the crowd together , they delivered the letter .
44015031	And having read it , they rejoiced over its encouragement .
44015032	And Yehuḏah and Sila , being themselves also prophets , encouraged the brothers with many words and strengthened them .
44015033	And having spent some time , they were sent back in peace from the brothers to the emissaries .
44015034	But it seemed good to Sila to remain .
44015035	And Sha’ul and Barnaḇah continued in Antioch , teaching and bringing , with many others also , the Good News : the Word of יהוה !
44015036	And after some days Sha’ul said to Barnaḇah , “ Let us now go back and visit our brothers in every city where we proclaimed the Word of יהוה , and see how they are . ”
44015037	And Barnaḇah purposed to take with them Yoḥanan called Mark .
44015038	But Sha’ul thought it not fit to take with them the one who withdrew from them in Pamphulia , and had not gone with them to the work .
44015039	A sharp feeling therefore came to be , so that they parted from one another . And so Barnaḇah took Mark and sailed to Cyprus .
44015040	And Sha’ul chose Sila and went off , being committed by the brothers to the favour of Elohim .
44015041	And he went through Syria and Kilikia , strengthening the assemblies .
44016001	And he came to Derbe and Lustra . And see , a certain taught one was there , named Timothy , the son of a certain Yehuḏite woman who believed – but his father was Greek –
44016002	who was well spoken of by the brothers who were at Lustra and Ikonion .
44016003	Sha’ul wished to have this one go with him . And he took him and circumcised him because of the Yehuḏim who were in those places , for they all knew that his father was Greek .
44016004	And as they went through the cities , they delivered to them the regulations to keep , which were decided by the emissaries and elders at Yerushalayim .
44016005	Then , indeed , the assemblies were strengthened in the belief , and increased in number every day .
44016006	And having passed through Phrygia and the Galatian country , they were forbidden by the Set-apart Spirit to speak the word in Asia .
44016007	When they came to Musia , they tried to go into Bithunia , but the Spirit did not allow them .
44016008	And having passed by Musia , they came down to Troas .
44016009	And in the night a vision appeared to Sha’ul : A man of Makedonia was standing , begging him and saying , “ Come over to Makedonia and help us . ”
44016010	And when he saw the vision , immediately we sought to go to Makedonia , concluding that the Master had called us to bring the Good News to them .
44016011	Therefore , sailing from Troas , we ran a straight course to Samothrake , and the next day came to Neapolis ,
44016012	and from there to Philippi , which is the principal city of that part of Makedonia , a colony . And we were staying in that city for some days .
44016013	And on the Sabbath day we went outside the city by a river , where there used to be prayer . And having sat down we were speaking to the women who met there .
44016014	And a certain woman named Ludia , a seller of purple from the city of Thyatira , worshipping Elohim , was hearing , whose heart the Master did open to pay attention to what Sha’ul said .
44016015	And when she was immersed , and her household , she begged us , saying , “ If you have judged me to be believing in the Master , come to my house and stay . ” And she urged us .
44016016	And it came to be , as we went to prayer , that a certain slave girl possessed with a spirit of Puthon , did meet us , who brought her masters much profit by foretelling .
44016017	Having followed Sha’ul and us , she cried out , saying , “ These men are the servants of the Most High Elohim , who proclaim to us the way of deliverance . ”
44016018	And she was doing this for many days . But Sha’ul , greatly annoyed , turned and said to the spirit , “ I command you in the Name of יהושע Messiah to come out of her . ” And it came out that same hour .
44016019	But when her masters saw that their anticipation of money-making was gone , they seized Sha’ul and Sila and dragged them into the market-place to the rulers .
44016020	And having brought them to the captains , they said , “ These men , being Yehuḏim , greatly disturb our city ,
44016021	and they proclaim practices which are not right for us to receive nor to do , being Romans . ”
44016022	And the crowd rose up together against them . And the captains tore off their garments and commanded them to be beaten with rods .
44016023	And having laid many blows upon them , they threw them into prison , commanding the jailer to keep them safely ,
44016024	who , having received such a command , put them into the inner prison and fastened their feet in the stocks .
44016025	And at midnight Sha’ul and Sila were praying and singing songs to Elohim , and the prisoners were listening to them .
44016026	And suddenly a great earthquake took place , so that the foundations of the prison were shaken , and immediately all the doors were opened and all the chains came loose .
44016027	And the jailer , awaking from sleep and seeing the prison doors open , thinking the prisoners had fled , drew his sword and was about to kill himself .
44016028	But Sha’ul called with a loud voice , saying , “ Do no harm to yourself , for we are all here . ”
44016029	And asking for a light , he ran in , and fell down trembling before Sha’ul and Sila .
44016030	And having led them outside he said , “ Masters , what do I have to do to be saved ? ”
44016031	And they said , “ Believe on the Master יהושע Messiah , and you shall be saved , you and your household . ”
44016032	And they spoke the Word of יהוה to him and to all who were in his house .
44016033	And taking them in that hour of the night , he washed their wounds , and immediately he was immersed , he and all that were his .
44016034	And having brought them into his house , he set food before them . And he rejoiced with all his household , having believed in Elohim .
44016035	And when day came , the authorities sent the officers , saying , “ Let these men go . ”
44016036	And the jailer reported these words to Sha’ul , saying , “ The captains have sent to let you go . Now then , come out and go in peace . ”
44016037	But Sha’ul said to them , “ They have beaten us publicly , uncondemned , being Romans . They have thrown us into prison , and now , do they throw us out secretly ? No indeed ! Let them come themselves and bring us out . ”
44016038	And the officers reported these words to the authorities , and they were afraid when they heard that they were Romans .
44016039	And having come , they pleaded with them and brought them out , and asked them to leave the city .
44016040	So coming out of the prison they went to Ludia , and seeing the brothers , they encouraged them , and went forth .
44017001	And having passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia , they came to Thessalonike , where there was a congregation of the Yehuḏim .
44017002	And according to his practice , Sha’ul went in unto them , and for three Sabbaths was reasoning with them from the Scriptures ,
44017003	explaining and pointing out that the Messiah had to suffer and rise again from the dead , and saying , “ This is the Messiah , יהושע , whom I proclaim to you . ”
44017004	And some of them did believe , and a large number of the worshipping Greeks , and not a few of the leading women , joined Sha’ul and Sila .
44017005	But the Yehuḏim who did not believe , having become envious , took some of the wicked men from the market-place , and gathering a mob , set all the city in an uproar and came upon the house of Jason , and were seeking to bring them out to the people .
44017006	But not finding them , they dragged Jason and some of the brothers to the city rulers , crying out , “ They who have turned the world upside down have come here too ,
44017007	whom Jason has received . And all of them are acting contrary to the dogmas of Caesar , saying there is another sovereign , יהושע . ”
44017008	And they troubled the crowd and the city rulers when they heard this .
44017009	And when they had received a pledge from Jason and the rest , they let them go .
44017010	And the brothers immediately sent Sha’ul and Sila away by night to Beroia , who , having come , went into the congregation of the Yehuḏim .
44017011	Now these were more noble than those in Thessalonike , who received the word with great eagerness , and searched the Scriptures daily , if these words were so .
44017012	Then many of them truly believed , and also not a few of the Greeks , decent women as well as men .
44017013	And when the Yehuḏim from Thessalonike came to know that the word of Elohim was proclaimed by Sha’ul at Beroia , they came there also and stirred up the crowds .
44017014	And then immediately the brothers sent Sha’ul away , to go to the sea , but both Sila and Timothy stayed there .
44017015	And those who arranged for Sha’ul brought him to Athens . And receiving a command for Sila and Timothy to join him as soon as possible , they departed .
44017016	But while Sha’ul was waiting for them at Athens , his spirit was stirred up within him when he saw that the city was utterly idolatrous .
44017017	Therefore , indeed , he was reasoning in the congregation with the Yehuḏim and with the gentile worshippers , and in the market-place daily with those who met there .
44017018	And some of the Epicurean and Stoic philosophers encountered him . And some were saying , “ What does this babbler wish to say ? ” Others said , “ He seems to be a proclaimer of strange mighty ones ” – because to them he brought the Good News : יהושע and the resurrection !
44017019	So they laid hold of him and brought him to the Areopagus , saying , “ Are we able to know what this fresh teaching is of which you speak ?
44017020	“ For you are bringing some strange matters to our ears . We wish , then , to know what these mean . ”
44017021	For all the Athenians and the strangers living there spent their leisure time in doing naught but to speak or to hear what is fresh .
44017022	And having stood in the midst of the Areopagus Sha’ul said , “ Men of Athens , I see that you are very religious in every matter .
44017023	“ For passing through and observing the objects of your worship , I even found an altar with this inscription : TO THE UNKNOWN MIGHTY ONE . Not knowing then whom you worship , I make Him known to you :
44017024	“ יהוה , who made the world and all that is in it , this One being Master of heaven and earth , does not dwell in dwellings made with hands .
44017025	“ Nor is He served with men’s hands – as if needing any – Himself giving to all life , and breath , and all else .
44017026	“ And He has made from one blood every nation of men to dwell on all the face of the earth , having ordained beforehand the times and the boundaries of their dwelling ,
44017027	to seek the Master , if at least they would reach out for Him and find Him , though He is not far from each one of us .
44017028	“ For in Him we live and move and are , as also some of your own poets have said , ‘ For we are also His offspring . ’
44017029	“ Now then , since we are the offspring of Elohim , we should not think that the Elohim is like gold or silver or stone , an image made by the skill and thought of man .
44017030	“ Truly , then , having overlooked these times of ignorance , Elohim now commands all men everywhere to repent ,
44017031	because He has set a day on which He is going to judge the world in righteousness by a Man whom He has appointed , having given proof of this to all by raising Him from the dead . ”
44017032	And hearing of the resurrection of the dead , some indeed mocked , while others said , “ We shall hear you again concerning this . ”
44017033	And so Sha’ul went out from among them .
44017034	But some men joined him and believed , among them Dionusios the Areopagite , and a woman named Damaris , and others with them .
44018001	And after this Sha’ul left Athens and went to Corinth .
44018002	And he found a certain Yehuḏite named Aqulas , born in Pontos , who had recently come from Italy with his wife Priscilla – because Claudius had commanded all the Yehuḏim to leave Rome – and he came to them .
44018003	And because he was of the same trade , he stayed with them and was working , for they were tentmakers by trade .
44018004	And he was reasoning in the congregation every Sabbath , and won over both Yehuḏim and Greeks .
44018005	And when Sila and Timothy came down from Makedonia , Sha’ul was pressed by the Spirit , and earnestly witnessed to the Yehuḏim that יהושע is the Messiah .
44018006	However , when they resisted and blasphemed , he shook his garments and said to them , “ Your blood is upon your head , I am clean . From now on I shall go to the gentiles . ”
44018007	And having left there he came to the house of a certain man named Justus , who worshipped Elohim , whose house was next to the congregation .
44018008	And Crispus , the ruler of the congregation , did believe in the Master with all his household . And many of the Corinthians , hearing , believed and were immersed .
44018009	And the Master spoke to Sha’ul in the night by a vision , “ Do not be afraid , but speak , and do not be silent ,
44018010	because I am with you , and no one shall attack you to do you evil , because I have much people in this city . ”
44018011	And he remained a year and six months , teaching the Word of יהוה among them .
44018012	And when Gallion was proconsul of Achaia , the Yehuḏim with one mind rose up against Sha’ul and brought him to the judgment seat ,
44018013	saying , “ This one does seduce men to worship Elohim contrary to the Torah . ”
44018014	And as Sha’ul was about to open his mouth , Gallion said to the Yehuḏim , “ If it were a matter of wrongdoing or wicked recklessness , O Yehuḏim , there would be reason why I should bear with you .
44018015	“ But if it is a question of words and names and a law which is among you , see to it yourselves , for I do not wish to be a judge of these matters . ”
44018016	And he drove them away from the judgment seat .
44018017	And all the Greeks took Sosthenes , the ruler of the congregation , and beat him before the judgment seat . But Gallion showed no concern whatever .
44018018	And Sha’ul , having stayed several days more , having taken leave of the brothers , was sailing for Syria , and Priscilla and Aqulas were with him , having shaved his hair at Kenḥrea , for he had taken a vow .
44018019	And he came to Ephesos , and left them there , but he himself went into the congregation and reasoned with the Yehuḏim .
44018020	And when they asked him to stay a longer time with them , he declined ,
44018021	but took leave of them , saying , “ I have to keep this coming festival in Yerushalayim by all means , but I shall come back to you , Elohim desiring so . ” And he sailed from Ephesos .
44018022	And having come to Caesarea , going up and greeting the assembly , he went down to Antioch .
44018023	And having spent some time there , he went forth , passing through the country of Galatia and on through Phrygia , strengthening all the taught ones .
44018024	And a certain Yehuḏite named Apollos , born at Alexandria , a learned man and mighty in the Scriptures , came to Ephesos .
44018025	This one had been instructed in the way of the Master . And being fervent in spirit , he was speaking and teaching the matters about the Master exactly , though he knew only the immersion of Yoḥanan .
44018026	And he began to speak boldly in the congregation . And when Aqulas and Priscilla heard him , they took him aside and explained to him the way of Elohim more exactly .
44018027	And when he intended to pass through to Achaia , the brothers , having encouraged him , wrote to the taught ones to receive him , who , having arrived , greatly helped those who believed through favour ,
44018028	for with power he refuted the Yehuḏim publicly , showing from the Scriptures that יהושע is the Messiah .
44019001	And it came to be , while Apollos was at Corinth , that Sha’ul , having passed through the upper parts , came to Ephesos . And having found some taught ones ,
44019002	he said to them , “ Did you receive the Set-apart Spirit when you believed ? ” And they said to him , “ No , we have not even heard that there is a Set-apart Spirit . ”
44019003	And he said to them , “ Into what then were you immersed ? ” And they said , “ Into Yoḥanan’s immersion . ”
44019004	And Sha’ul said , “ Yoḥanan indeed immersed with an immersion of repentance , saying to the people that they should believe in the One who is coming after him , that is , in Messiah יהושע . ”
44019005	And when they heard this , they were immersed in the Name of the Master יהושע .
44019006	And when Sha’ul had laid hands on them , the Set-apart Spirit came upon them , and they were speaking in tongues and prophesying .
44019007	And all the men were about twelve .
44019008	And having gone into the congregation he spoke boldly for three months , reasoning and persuading concerning the reign of Elohim .
44019009	But when some were hardened and did not believe , speaking evil of the Way before the crowd , he withdrew from them and separated the taught ones , reasoning daily in the school of Turannos .
44019010	And this took place for two years , so that all who dwelt in Asia heard the word of the Master יהושע , both Yehuḏim and Greeks .
44019011	And Elohim worked unusual miracles through the hands of Sha’ul ,
44019012	so that even handkerchiefs or aprons were brought from his body to the sick , and the diseases left them and the wicked spirits went out of them .
44019013	But certain roving Yehuḏite exorcists took it upon themselves to call the Name of the Master יהושע over those who had wicked spirits , saying , “ We exorcise you by יהושע whom Sha’ul proclaims . ”
44019014	And there were seven sons of a certain Skeua , a Yehuḏite chief priest , who were doing this .
44019015	And the wicked spirit answering , said , “ יהושע I know , and Sha’ul I know , but who are you ? ”
44019016	And the man in whom the wicked spirit was leaped on them , overpowered them , and prevailed against them , so that they fled out of that house naked and wounded .
44019017	And this became known to all , both Yehuḏim and Greeks dwelling in Ephesos . And fear fell on them all , and the Name of the Master יהושע was made great .
44019018	And many who had believed came confessing and declaring their deeds .
44019019	And many of those who had practised magic brought their books together , burning them before all . And they reckoned up the value of them , and found it to be fifty thousand pieces of silver .
44019020	So the word of the Master was growing mightily and prevailing .
44019021	Now when these matters had been completed , Sha’ul purposed in the Spirit , when he had passed through Makedonia and Achaia , to go to Yerushalayim , saying , “ After I have been there , I have to see Rome too . ”
44019022	And having sent into Makedonia two of those assisting him , Timothy and Ěrastos , he himself remained in Asia for a time .
44019023	And about that time there came to be a great commotion about the Way .
44019024	For a certain man named Demetrios , a silversmith , who made silver shrines of Artemis , provided no little business to the craftsmen ,
44019025	who , having called them together , with the workers of similar trade , said , “ Men , you know that our wealth is from this business .
44019026	“ And you see and hear that not only at Ephesos , but throughout almost all Asia , this Sha’ul has persuaded and turned away a large number , saying that they are not mighty ones which are made with hands .
44019027	“ And not only is this trade of ours in danger of coming to rejection , but also that the temple of the great female mighty one Artemis whom all Asia and the world worship , shall be regarded as worthless and her greatness diminished . ”
44019028	And having heard this , they were filled with rage and cried out , saying , “ Great is Artemis of the Ephesians ! ”
44019029	And the entire city was filled with confusion , and they rushed with one mind into the theatre , having seized Gaios and Aristarchos , Makedonians , Sha’ul’s fellow travellers .
44019030	And Sha’ul , intending to go in among the mob , the taught ones did not allow him .
44019031	And some of the officials of Asia , being his friends , sent to him begging him not to risk himself into the theatre .
44019032	Then others indeed shouted this and others that , for the assembly was confused , and most of them did not know why they had come together .
44019033	And some of the crowd instructed Alexander – the Yehuḏim putting him forward . And Alexander motioned with his hand , and wished to make his defence to the people .
44019034	But having recognised that he was a Yehuḏite , all with one voice cried out for about two hours , “ Great is Artemis of the Ephesians ! ”
44019035	And the city clerk , having calmed the crowd , said , “ Men of Ephesos , what man is there who does not know that the city of the Ephesians is the guardian of the temple of the great female mighty one Artemis , and of that which fell down from Zeus ?
44019036	“ Therefore , if these matters are undeniable , you need to be calm , and do not act rashly .
44019037	“ For you have brought these men here who are neither temple-robbers nor speaking evil of your female mighty one .
44019038	“ If truly then Demetrios and his fellow craftsmen have a case against anyone , the courts are open and there are proconsuls . Let them accuse one another .
44019039	“ And if you have any further complaint , it shall be settled in the regular assembly .
44019040	“ For we are in danger of being accused of riot concerning today , there being no reason which we could give to account for this disorderly gathering . ”
44019041	And having said this , he dismissed the assembly .
44020001	After the uproar had ceased , Sha’ul called the taught ones to him , and having embraced them , went away to go to Makedonia .
44020002	And having gone through those parts , and having encouraged them with many words , he came to Greece ,
44020003	where he spent three months . When he was about to sail to Syria , he decided to return through Makedonia , as a plot was made against him by the Yehuḏim .
44020004	And he was accompanied by Sopater of Beroia , and Aristarchos and Sekundos of the Thessalonians , and Gaios of Derbe , and Timothy , and Tuchikos and Trophimos of Asia .
44020005	And these , going ahead , waited for us at Troas .
44020006	And we sailed away from Philippi after the Days of Unleavened Bread , and came to them at Troas in five days , where we stayed seven days .
44020007	And on the first day of the week , the taught ones having gathered together to break bread , Sha’ul , intending to depart the next day , was reasoning with them and was extending the word till midnight .
44020008	And there were many lamps in the upper room where they were assembled .
44020009	And a certain young man , by name Eutuchos , was sitting in a window , being overpowered by a deep sleep . As Sha’ul kept on reasoning , he was overcome by sleep and fell down from the third storey , and was picked up dead .
44020010	And Sha’ul , having gone down , fell on him , and embracing him said , “ Do not be upset , for his life is in him . ”
44020011	Then going up again , and having broken bread and eaten , he talked a long while , even till daybreak , and so went forth .
44020012	And they brought the young man in alive , and were encouraged , not a little .
44020013	And we , going ahead to the ship , sailed to Assos , intending to take Sha’ul on board there , for so he had arranged , intending himself to go on foot .
44020014	And when he met us at Assos , we took him on board and came to Mitulene .
44020015	And from there we sailed , and the next day came opposite Chios . And the next day we arrived at Samos and remained at Trogullion . And the following day we came to Miletos .
44020016	For Sha’ul had decided to sail past Ephesos , so that he might lose no time in Asia , for he was hurrying to be at Yerushalayim , if possible , on the Day of the Festival of Weeks .
44020017	And from Miletos he sent to Ephesos and called for the elders of the assembly .
44020018	And when they had come to him , he said to them , “ You know , from the first day that I came to Asia , how I was with you all the time ,
44020019	serving the Master with all humility , with many tears and trials which befell me by the plotting of the Yehuḏim ,
44020020	as I kept back no matter that was profitable , but proclaimed it to you , and taught you publicly and from house to house ,
44020021	witnessing to Yehuḏim , and also to Greeks : repentance toward Elohim and belief in our Master יהושע Messiah .
44020022	“ And now see , I go bound in the spirit to Yerushalayim , not knowing what is going to meet me there ,
44020023	except that the Set-apart Spirit witnesses in every city , saying that chains and pressures await me .
44020024	“ But I do not count my life of any value to me , so that I might accomplish my mission with joy , and the service which I received from the Master יהושע , to bear witness to the Good News of the favour of Elohim .
44020025	“ And now see , I know that you all , among whom I went about proclaiming the reign of Elohim , shall see my face no more .
44020026	“ Therefore I witness to you this day that I am clear from the blood of all .
44020027	“ For I kept not back from declaring to you all the counsel of Elohim .
44020028	“ Therefore take heed to yourselves and to all the flock , among which the Set-apart Spirit has made you overseers , to shepherd the assembly of Elohim which He has purchased with His own blood .
44020029	“ For I know this , that after my departure savage wolves shall come in among you , not sparing the flock .
44020030	“ Also from among yourselves men shall arise , speaking distorted teachings , to draw away the taught ones after themselves .
44020031	“ Therefore watch , remembering that for three years , night and day , I did not cease to warn each one with tears .
44020032	“ And now , brothers , I commit you to Elohim and to the word of His favour , which is able to build you up and give you an inheritance among all those having been set apart .
44020033	“ I have coveted no one’s silver or gold or garments .
44020034	“ And you yourselves know that these hands supplied my needs , and for those who were with me .
44020035	“ All this I did show you , by labouring like this , that you ought to help the weak . And remember the words of the Master יהושע , that He said , ‘ It is more blessed to give than to receive . ’ ”
44020036	And having said this , he knelt down and prayed with them all .
44020037	And there was much weeping among them all , and falling on Sha’ul’s neck , they kissed him ,
44020038	distressed most of all because of the word which he had said , that they would see his face no more . And they went with him to the ship .
44021001	And it came to be , when we had torn ourselves away from them , and had set sail , we ran a straight course and came to Cos , and the next day to Rhodes , and from there to Patara .
44021002	And having found a ship passing over to Phoenicia , we went aboard and set sail .
44021003	And having sighted Cyprus , and having passed it on the left , we sailed to Syria , and landed at Tsor , for the ship was to unload her cargo there .
44021004	And having found taught ones , we remained there seven days . And they told Sha’ul through the Spirit not to go up to Yerushalayim .
44021005	And when it came to be that our days there were ended , we left and went on , all of them accompanying us , with wives and children , till we were out of the city . And kneeling down on the beach , we prayed .
44021006	And having embraced one another , we boarded the ship , and they returned to their homes .
44021007	And when we had completed our voyage from Tsor , we came to Ptolemais . And having greeted the brothers we stayed with them one day .
44021008	And on the next day we left and came to Caesarea , and went into the house of Philip the evangelist , who was one of the seven , and stayed with him .
44021009	Now this one had four maiden daughters who prophesied .
44021010	And as we were staying many days , a certain prophet named Ḥag̅aḇ came down from Yehuḏah ,
44021011	and having come to us , he took the girdle of Sha’ul , bound his own hands and feet , and said , “ Thus says the Set-apart Spirit , ‘ Thus shall the Yehuḏim at Yerushalayim bind the man who owns this girdle , and deliver him into the hands of the gentiles . ’ ”
44021012	And when we heard this , both we and those from that place begged him not to go up to Yerushalayim .
44021013	And Sha’ul answered , “ What do you mean by weeping and breaking my heart ? For I am ready not only to be bound , but also to die at Yerushalayim for the Name of the Master יהושע . ”
44021014	And as he could not be persuaded , we ceased , saying , “ Let the desire of the Master be done . ”
44021015	And after those days , having made ready , we went up to Yerushalayim .
44021016	And also some of the taught ones from Caesarea went with us and brought with them one , Mnason of Cyprus , an early taught one , with whom we were to lodge .
44021017	And when we had arrived in Yerushalayim , the brothers received us gladly .
44021018	And on the following day Sha’ul went in with us to Ya‛aqoḇ , and all the elders came .
44021019	And having greeted them , he was relating one by one what Elohim had done among the gentiles through his service .
44021020	And when they heard it , they praised the Master . And they said to him , “ You see , brother , how many thousands of Yehuḏim there are who have believed , and all are ardent for the Torah .
44021021	“ And they have been informed about you that you teach all the Yehuḏim who are among the gentiles to forsake Mosheh , saying not to circumcise the children nor to walk according to the practices .
44021022	“ What then is it ? They shall certainly hear that you have come .
44021023	“ So do this , what we say to you : We have four men who have taken a vow .
44021024	“ Take them and be cleansed with them , and pay their expenses so that they shave their heads . And all shall know that what they have been informed about you is not so , but that you yourself also walk orderly , keeping the Torah .
44021025	“ But concerning the gentiles who believe , we have written and decided that they should keep themselves from what is offered to idols , and blood , and what is strangled , and whoring . ”
44021026	Then Sha’ul took the men on the next day , and having been cleansed with them , went into the Set-apart Place to announce the completion of the days of separation – until the offering should be presented for each one of them .
44021027	And when the seven days were almost ended , the Yehuḏim from Asia , seeing him in the Set-apart Place , were stirring up all the crowd , and they laid hands on him ,
44021028	crying out , “ Men of Yisra’ĕl , help ! This is the man who is teaching all men everywhere against the people , and the Torah , and this place . And besides , he also brought Greeks into the Set-apart Place and has profaned this Set-apart Place . ”
44021029	Because they had previously seen Trophimos the Ephesian with him in the city , whom they thought that Sha’ul had brought into the Set-apart Place .
44021030	And the entire city was moved , and the people rushed together , seized Sha’ul , and dragged him out of the Set-apart Place . And immediately the doors were shut .
44021031	And while they were seeking to kill him , a report came to the commander of the company of soldiers that all Yerushalayim was in confusion .
44021032	At once he took soldiers and captains , and ran down to them . And they , having seen the commander and the soldiers , stopped beating Sha’ul .
44021033	Then the commander came near and took him , and commanded him to be bound with two chains , and was asking who he was and what he had done .
44021034	And in the crowd some were shouting this and others that . And not being able to ascertain the truth because of the uproar , he commanded him to be taken into the barracks .
44021035	And when he came to the stairs , he had to be carried by the soldiers because of the violence of the crowd .
44021036	For a large number of the people followed after , crying out , “ Away with him ! ”
44021037	And as Sha’ul was about to be led into the barracks , he said to the commander , “ Am I allowed to say somewhat to you ? ” And he said , “ Do you know Greek ?
44021038	“ Are you not the Mitsrite who some time ago stirred up a revolt and led the four thousand assassins out into the wilderness ? ”
44021039	But Sha’ul replied , “ I am a Yehuḏite from Tarsos , in Kilikia , a citizen of no mean city . And I beg you , allow me to speak to the people . ”
44021040	And having given him permission , Sha’ul , standing on the stairs motioned with his hand to the people . And when there was a great silence , he spoke in the Heḇrew language , saying ,
44022001	“ Men , brothers , and fathers , hear my defence before you now . ”
44022002	And when they heard that he spoke to them in the Heḇrew language , they kept greater silence . And he said :
44022003	“ I am indeed a Yehuḏite , having been born in Tarsos of Kilikia , but brought up in this city at the feet of Gamli’ĕl , having been instructed according to the exactness of the Torah of our fathers , being ardent for Elohim , as you all are today ,
44022004	who persecuted this Way to the death , binding and delivering up into prisons both men and women ,
44022005	as also the high priest bears me witness , and all the eldership , from whom I also received letters to the brothers , and went to Damascus to bring in chains even those who were there to Yerushalayim to be punished .
44022006	“ And it came to be , as I was journeying and coming near Damascus , about noon , suddenly a great light shone around me out of the heaven ,
44022007	and I fell to the ground and heard a voice saying to me , ‘ Sha’ul , Sha’ul , why do you persecute Me ? ’
44022008	“ And I answered , ‘ Who are You , Master ? ’ And He said to me , ‘ I am יהושע of Natsareth , whom you persecute . ’
44022009	“ And those who were with me indeed saw the light and were afraid , but they did not hear His voice speaking to me .
44022010	“ And I said , ‘ What shall I do , Master ? ’ And the Master said to me , ‘ Rise up , go into Damascus , and there you shall be told all that you have been appointed to do . ’
44022011	“ And as I could not see because of the esteem of that light , being led by the hand of those who were with me , I came into Damascus .
44022012	“ And a certain Ḥananyah , a dedicated man according to the Torah , being well spoken of by all the Yehuḏim dwelling there ,
44022013	came to me , and stood by and said to me , ‘ Brother Sha’ul , look up . ’ And at that same hour I looked up at him .
44022014	“ And he said , ‘ The Elohim of our fathers has appointed you to know His desire , and to see the Righteous One , and to hear the voice from His mouth .
44022015	‘ Because you shall be His witness to all men of what you have seen and heard .
44022016	‘ And now , why do you delay ? Rise up , be immersed , and wash away your sins , calling on the Name of יהוה . ’
44022017	“ And it came to be , when I returned to Yerushalayim , and while I was praying in the Set-apart Place , I came to be in a trance ,
44022018	and I saw Him saying to me , ‘ Hurry and get out of Yerushalayim , speedily , because they shall not accept your witness concerning Me . ’
44022019	“ And I said , ‘ Master , they know that in every congregation I was imprisoning and beating those who believe on You .
44022020	‘ And when the blood of Your witness Stephanos was shed , I also was standing by giving my approval to his death , and keeping the garments of those who were killing him . ’
44022021	“ And He said to me , ‘ Go , because I shall send you far from here to the gentiles . ’ ”
44022022	And they were listening to him until this word , and then they lifted up their voice , saying , “ Away with such a one from the earth , for it is not fit that he should live ! ”
44022023	As they were shouting and tearing their garments , and throwing dust into the air ,
44022024	the commander ordered him to be brought into the barracks , and said that he should be examined by flogging , in order to find out why they were shouting so against him .
44022025	And as they were stretching him out with straps , Sha’ul said to the captain who was standing by , “ Is it permitted for you to whip a man who is a Roman , and uncondemned ? ”
44022026	And when the captain heard , he went and reported to the commander , saying , “ Watch what you are about to do , for this man is a Roman . ”
44022027	And having come , the commander said to him , “ Say to me , are you a Roman ? ” And he said , “ Yes . ”
44022028	And the commander answered , “ With a large sum I obtained this citizenship . ” And Sha’ul said , “ But I was even born so . ”
44022029	Then at once those who were about to examine him withdrew from him . And the commander was also afraid after he found out that he was a Roman , and because he had bound him .
44022030	And on the next day , intending to know for certain why he was accused by the Yehuḏim , he released him , and commanded the chief priests and all their council to come , and brought Sha’ul down and set him before them .
44023001	And Sha’ul , looking intently at the council , said , “ Men , brothers , I have lived in all good conscience before Elohim until this day . ”
44023002	And the high priest Ḥananyah commanded those who stood by him to strike him on the mouth .
44023003	Then Sha’ul said to him , “ Elohim is going to strike you , whitewashed wall ! And do you sit judging me according to the Torah , and do you command me to be struck contrary to the Torah ? ”
44023004	And those who stood by said , “ Do you revile the high priest of Elohim ? ”
44023005	And Sha’ul said , “ I did not know , brothers , that he was the high priest , for it has been written , ‘ You shall not speak evil of the ruler of your people . ’ ”
44023006	Now Sha’ul , perceiving that one part were Sadducees and the other Pharisees , cried out in the council , “ Men , brothers , I am a Pharisee , the son of a Pharisee , I am being judged concerning the expectation and resurrection of the dead ! ”
44023007	And when he had said this , there came a dissension between the Pharisees and the Sadducees . And the crowd was divided .
44023008	For the Sadducees say that there is no resurrection , nor messenger nor spirit , but the Pharisees confess both .
44023009	And there was a great uproar . And certain of the scribes of the party of Pharisees were earnestly contending , saying , “ We find no evil in this man . And if a spirit or a messenger has spoken to him , let us not fight against Elohim . ”
44023010	And a great dissension having come , the commander , fearing lest Sha’ul would be pulled to pieces by them , commanded the body of soldiers to go down and seize him from their midst , and bring him into the barracks .
44023011	And on the following night the Master stood by him and said , “ Take courage , Sha’ul , for as you have witnessed for Me in Yerushalayim , so you have to bear witness at Rome too . ”
44023012	And when it became day , some of the Yehuḏim made a conspiracy and bound themselves under an oath , saying that they would neither eat nor drink until they had killed Sha’ul .
44023013	And those making this conspiracy were more than forty ,
44023014	who , having come to the chief priests and elders , said , “ We have bound ourselves under a great oath not to eat at all until we have killed Sha’ul .
44023015	“ Now , then , you , with the council , inform the commander to have him brought down to you tomorrow , as intending to examine more exactly all about him . And we are ready to kill him before he comes near . ”
44023016	And when Sha’ul’s sister’s son heard of their ambush , he went and entered into the barracks and reported to Sha’ul .
44023017	And Sha’ul , having called one of the captains to him , said , “ Take this young man to the commander , for he has somewhat to report to him . ”
44023018	He indeed then took him and led him to the commander and said , “ The prisoner Sha’ul called me to him and asked me to bring this young man to you , having somewhat to say to you . ”
44023019	And the commander , having taken him by the hand , went aside by themselves and asked , “ What is it that you have to report to me ? ”
44023020	And he said , “ The Yehuḏim have agreed to ask that you bring Sha’ul down to the council tomorrow , as intending to inquire more exactly about him .
44023021	“ Therefore , do not let them persuade you , for more than forty of them lie in wait for him , men who have bound themselves by an oath neither to eat nor to drink until they have killed him . And now they are ready , waiting for the promise from you . ”
44023022	Then the commander dismissed the young man , having commanded him , “ Inform no one that you reported this to me . ”
44023023	And having called near a certain two captains , he said , “ Get two hundred soldiers ready to go to Caesarea , and seventy horsemen , and two hundred spearmen , after the third hour of the night ,
44023024	and provide beasts , on which to place Sha’ul , and bring him safely to Felix the governor , ”
44023025	having written a letter in this form :
44023026	Claudius Lysias , to the most excellent governor Felix : Greetings .
44023027	This man , having been seized by the Yehuḏim , and being about to be killed by them , I rescued , having come with the body of soldiers , having learned that he was a Roman .
44023028	And , desiring to know the reason they accused him , I brought him before their council .
44023029	I found out that he was accused concerning questions of their Torah , but there was no charge against him deserving death or chains .
44023030	And when I was informed that there was to be a plot against the man by the Yehuḏim , I sent him immediately to you , having also commanded his accusers to state before you the charges against him . Be strong !
44023031	So the soldiers , as they were commanded , took Sha’ul and brought him by night to Antipatris .
44023032	And on the next day they left the horsemen to go on with him , and returned to the barracks ,
44023033	who , having come to Caesarea , and delivered the letter to the governor , they also presented Sha’ul to him .
44023034	And the governor , having read it , and having asked of what province he was , and being informed that he was from Kilikia ,
44023035	said , “ I shall hear you when your accusers arrive also . ” And he commanded him to be kept in Herodes’ palace .
44024001	And after five days the high priest Ḥananyah came down , with the elders , and a certain speaker – Tertullus . And they brought charges against Sha’ul before the governor .
44024002	And when he was called upon , Tertullus began to accuse him , saying , “ Having obtained great peace through you , and reforms being brought to this nation by your forethought ,
44024003	we accept it always and in all places , most excellent Felix , with all thanks .
44024004	“ But in order not to hinder you any further , I beg you to hear us briefly in your gentleness .
44024005	“ For having found this man a plague , who stirs up dissension among all the Yehuḏim throughout the world , and a ringleader of the sect of the Natsarenes ,
44024006	who also tried to profane the Set-apart Place , and whom we seized , and wished to judge him according to our law ,
44024007	but the commander Lysias came along and with much violence took him out of our hands ,
44024008	commanding his accusers to come to you . And by examining him yourself you shall be able to know all these matters of which we accuse him . ”
44024009	And the Yehuḏim also agreed , maintaining that these matters were so .
44024010	And when the governor had motioned him to speak , Sha’ul answered , “ Knowing that for many years you have been a judge of this nation , I gladly defend myself ,
44024011	seeing you are able to know that it is not more than twelve days since I went up to Yerushalayim to worship .
44024012	“ And they neither found me in the Set-apart Place disputing with anyone nor stirring up the crowd , either in the congregations or in the city .
44024013	“ Nor are they able to prove the charges of which they now accuse me .
44024014	“ And this I confess to you , that according to the Way which they call a sect , so I worship the Elohim of my fathers , believing all that has been written in the Torah and in the Prophets ,
44024015	having an expectation in Elohim , which they themselves also wait for , that there is to be a resurrection of the dead , both of the righteous and the unrighteous .
44024016	“ And in this I exercise myself to have a clear conscience toward Elohim and men always .
44024017	“ And after many years I came to bring kind deeds to my nation and offerings ,
44024018	at which time certain Yehuḏim from Asia found me cleansed in the Set-apart Place , neither with a crowd nor with disturbance ,
44024019	who ought to be present before you to bring charges if they have any matter against me .
44024020	“ Or else let these themselves say if they found any wrongdoing in me while I stood before the council ,
44024021	other than for this one declaration which I cried out , standing among them , ‘ Concerning the resurrection of the dead I am being judged by you today . ’ ”
44024022	And having heard this , having known more exactly about the Way , Felix put them off , saying , “ When Lysias the commander comes down , I shall decide your case . ”
44024023	And he ordered the captain to keep Sha’ul and to have ease , and not to forbid any of his friends to attend to him .
44024024	And after some days , when Felix came with his wife Drusilla , who was a female Yehuḏite , he sent for Sha’ul and heard him concerning the belief in Messiah .
44024025	And as he reasoned about righteousness , and self-control , and the judgment to come , Felix became frightened and said , “ For the present , go . And when I find time I shall send for you . ”
44024026	At the same time too he was anticipating that silver would be given him by Sha’ul , that he might release him . Therefore he sent for him more often and conversed with him .
44024027	But after two years had passed Porcius Festus succeeded Felix . And wishing to do the Yehuḏim a favour , Felix left Sha’ul bound .
44025001	Festus therefore , having come to the province , three days later went up from Caesarea to Yerushalayim .
44025002	And the high priest and the chief men of the Yehuḏim informed him against Sha’ul , and they begged him ,
44025003	asking a favour against him , that he would send him to Yerushalayim – making a plot along the way to kill him .
44025004	Then , indeed , Festus answered that Sha’ul should be kept at Caesarea , and that he himself was about to set out shortly .
44025005	“ Therefore , ” he said , “ let those who have authority among you go down with me and accuse this man , to see if there is any fault in him . ”
44025006	And having spent more than ten days among them , he went down to Caesarea . And on the next day , sitting on the judgment seat , he commanded Sha’ul to be brought .
44025007	And when he had come , the Yehuḏim who had come down from Yerushalayim stood about , bringing many and heavy charges against Sha’ul , which they were unable to prove ,
44025008	while Sha’ul said in his own defence , “ Neither against the Torah of the Yehuḏim , nor against the Set-apart Place , nor against Caesar did I commit any sin . ”
44025009	But Festus , wishing to do the Yehuḏim a favour , answering Sha’ul , said , “ Do you wish to go up to Yerushalayim and be judged before me there concerning these matters ? ”
44025010	And Sha’ul said , “ I am standing at Caesar’s judgment seat , where I should be judged . To the Yehuḏim I have done no wrong , as you know well enough .
44025011	“ For if indeed I do wrong , or have committed whatever deserving death , I do not refuse to die . But if there is none at all in these matters of which these men accuse me , no one is able to give me up to them . I appeal to Caesar . ”
44025012	Then Festus , having talked with the council , answered , “ You have appealed to Caesar ? To Caesar you shall go ! ”
44025013	And certain days having passed , Sovereign Agrippa and Bernike came to Caesarea to greet Festus .
44025014	And when they had spent many days there , Festus laid Sha’ul’s case before the sovereign , saying , “ There is a man here whom Felix left as a prisoner ,
44025015	about whom the chief priests and the elders of the Yehuḏim informed me , when I was in Yerushalayim , asking for a judgment against him .
44025016	“ To them I answered , ‘ It is not the Roman practice to give up any man to destruction before the accused meets the accusers face to face , and has a chance to answer for himself concerning the charge against him . ’
44025017	“ They , therefore , having come together , without any delay , I sat on the judgment seat the next day and commanded the man to be brought in .
44025018	“ When the accusers stood up , they brought no charge against him such as I expected ,
44025019	but had some questions against him about their own worship and about a certain יהושע , who had died , whom Sha’ul was claiming to be alive .
44025020	“ And being uncertain how to investigate these matters , I asked whether he wished to go to Yerushalayim and there be judged concerning these matters .
44025021	“ But when Sha’ul appealed to be kept for the decision of Augustus , I ordered him to be kept until I send him to Caesar . ”
44025022	And Agrippa said to Festus , “ I was wishing also to hear the man myself . ” And he said , “ Tomorrow , you shall hear him . ”
44025023	Therefore , on the next day , Agrippa and Bernike having come with great show , and having entered the place of hearing with the commanders and the eminent men of the city , Sha’ul was brought in at the order of Festus .
44025024	And Festus said , “ Sovereign Agrippa and all the men present here with us , you see this one about whom all the community of the Yehuḏim pleaded with me , both at Yerushalayim and here , shouting that he ought not to be living any longer .
44025025	“ But I , having found that he had committed none at all deserving death , and that he himself had appealed to Augustus , I decided to send him .
44025026	“ I have no definite matter to write to my master concerning him . Therefore I have brought him out before you , and most of all before you , Sovereign Agrippa , so that after the examination has taken place I might have somewhat to write .
44025027	“ For it seems to me unreasonable to send a prisoner and not to signify the charges against him . ”
44026001	And Agrippa said to Sha’ul , “ You are allowed to speak for yourself . ” Then Sha’ul stretched out his hand and made his defence :
44026002	“ I think myself blessed , Sovereign Agrippa , because today I shall make my defence before you concerning all of which I am accused by the Yehuḏim ,
44026003	you being most of all an expert , knowing of all practices and questions which have to do with the Yehuḏim . So , please hear me patiently .
44026004	“ Truly , then , all the Yehuḏim know my way of life from youth , which I led from the beginning among my own nation at Yerushalayim ,
44026005	since they have known me from the first , if they wish to witness , that I lived as a Pharisee according to the strictest sect of our observance .
44026006	“ And now I stand and am judged for the expectation of the promise made by Elohim to our fathers ,
44026007	to which our twelve tribes , earnestly serving Elohim night and day , expect to attain . Concerning this expectation , O Sovereign Agrippa , I am accused by the Yehuḏim .
44026008	“ Why is it considered ‘ unbelievable’ among you if Elohim raises the dead ?
44026009	“ Therefore , indeed , I thought within myself that I ought to do much against the Name of יהושע of Natsareth ,
44026010	which also I did in Yerushalayim , and I shut up many of the set-apart ones in prison , having received authority from the chief priests . And when they were put to death , I gave my vote against them .
44026011	“ And punishing them often in all the congregations , I compelled them to blaspheme . And being exceedingly enraged against them , I persecuted them even to foreign cities .
44026012	“ While thus engaged , as I was journeying to Damascus with authority and commission from the chief priests ,
44026013	at midday along the highway , O sovereign , I saw a light from heaven , brighter than the sun , shining around me and those who journeyed with me .
44026014	“ And when we had all fallen to the ground , I heard a voice speaking to me , and saying in the Heḇrew language , ‘ Sha’ul , Sha’ul , why do you persecute Me ? It is hard for you to kick against the prods . ’
44026015	“ And I said , ‘ Who are You , Master ? ’ And He said , ‘ I am יהושע , whom you persecute .
44026016	‘ But rise up , and stand on your feet , for I have appeared to you for this purpose , to appoint you a servant and a witness both of what you saw and of those which I shall reveal to you ,
44026017	delivering you from the people , and the gentiles , to whom I now send you ,
44026018	to open their eyes , to turn them from darkness to light , and the authority of Satan to Elohim , in order for them to receive forgiveness of sins and an inheritance among those who are set-apart by belief in Me . ’
44026019	“ Therefore , Sovereign Agrippa , I was not disobedient to the heavenly vision ,
44026020	but declared first to those in Damascus and in Yerushalayim , and in all the country of Yehuḏah , and to the gentiles , that they should repent , and turn to Elohim , and do works worthy of repentance .
44026021	“ That is why the Yehuḏim seized me in the Set-apart Place and tried to kill me .
44026022	“ Therefore , having obtained help from Elohim , to this day I stand , witnessing both to small and great , saying nil else than what the prophets and Mosheh said would come –
44026023	that the Messiah would suffer , would be the first to rise from the dead , He would proclaim light to the people and to the gentiles . ”
44026024	And while saying this in his defence , Festus said with a loud voice , “ Sha’ul , you are mad ! Much learning is turning you to madness ! ”
44026025	But Sha’ul said , “ I am not mad , most excellent Festus , but I speak words of truth and sense .
44026026	“ For the sovereign , before whom I also speak boldly , knows these matters . For I am persuaded that none of these are hidden from him , for this has not been done in a corner .
44026027	“ Sovereign Agrippa , do you believe the prophets ? I know that you do believe . ”
44026028	And Agrippa said to Sha’ul , “ With a little you might persuade me to become a Messianite ! ”
44026029	And Sha’ul said , “ Much or little , I pray to Elohim that not only you , but also all who hear me today , might become such as I also am , except for these chains . ”
44026030	And having said this , the sovereign stood up , as well as the governor and Bernike and those sitting with them ,
44026031	and having withdrawn , they spoke to each other , saying , “ This man is doing none at all deserving death or chains . ”
44026032	And Agrippa said to Festus , “ This man could have been released if he had not appealed to Caesar . ”
44027001	And when it was decided that we should sail to Italy , they delivered Sha’ul and some other prisoners to one named Julius , a captain of the Augustan regiment .
44027002	And having embarked in a ship from Adramyttium , about to sail along the coasts of Asia , did set sail . Aristarchos , a Makedonian of Thessalonike , was with us .
44027003	And on the next day we landed at Tsiḏon . And Julius treated Sha’ul kindly and allowed him to go to his friends to receive attention .
44027004	And from there we put out to sea and sailed close to Cyprus , because the winds were against us .
44027005	And having sailed over the sea along Kilikia and Pamphulia , we came to Mura , of Lukia .
44027006	And there the captain , having found an Alexandrian ship sailing to Italy , did put us on board .
44027007	And having sailed slowly many days , and arriving with difficulty off Knidos , the wind not allowing us to proceed , we sailed close to Crete , off Salmone .
44027008	And passing it with difficulty , we came to a place called Fair Havens , near the city of Lasea .
44027009	And much time having passed , and the sailing now being dangerous , because the Fast was already over , Sha’ul advised them ,
44027010	saying , “ Men , I see that this voyage is going to end with damage and great loss , not only of the cargo and ship , but also our lives . ”
44027011	But the captain was persuaded by the pilot and the owner of the ship , rather than what Sha’ul said .
44027012	And because the harbour was unsuitable to winter in , the greater part advised to set sail from there too , if somehow they were able to reach Phoenix , a harbour of Crete facing southwest and northwest , to pass the winter .
44027013	And a south wind blowing softly , thinking they had obtained their purpose , having lifted anchor , they sailed along Crete , close inshore .
44027014	And not long after , a stormy head wind rushed down from it , called Northeaster .
44027015	And when the ship was caught in it , and unable to head against the wind , we let her go and were driven .
44027016	And having run under a small island called Klauda , we were hardly able to control the small boat .
44027017	And having hoisted it , they used helps to undergird the ship . And fearing lest they should run aground on Surtis , they lowered the tackle and so were driven .
44027018	And because we were exceedingly storm-tossed , the next day they began to throw overboard .
44027019	And on the third day we threw out the ship’s tackle with our own hands .
44027020	When , now , neither sun nor stars appeared for many days , and no small storm beat on us , all expectancy that we would be saved was taken away .
44027021	And when there had been a long abstinence from food , then Sha’ul , standing in the midst of them , said , “ Truly , men , you should have listened to me not to have sailed from Crete and sustained this damage and loss .
44027022	“ And now I urge you to take courage , for there shall be no loss of life among you , but only of the ship .
44027023	“ For tonight a messenger of the Elohim to whom I belong and whom I serve , stood by me ,
44027024	saying , ‘ Do not be afraid , Sha’ul , you have to be brought before Caesar . And look , Elohim has favourably given you all those who sail with you . ’
44027025	“ Therefore take courage , men , for I believe Elohim that it shall be according to the way it was spoken to me .
44027026	“ However , we need to run aground on some island . ”
44027027	And when the fourteenth night came , as we were driven up and down in the Adriatic Sea , about midnight the sailors suspected that they were drawing near some land .
44027028	So , taking soundings , they found it to be twenty fathoms . And a little farther on they took soundings again and found it to be fifteen fathoms .
44027029	And , fearing lest we should run aground on the rocks , they dropped four anchors from the stern , and were praying for day to come .
44027030	But when the sailors were seeking to escape from the ship , when they had let down the boat into the sea , under pretence of going to cast out anchors from the prow ,
44027031	Sha’ul said to the captain and the soldiers , “ If these do not remain in the ship , it is impossible for you to be saved . ”
44027032	Then the soldiers did cut the ropes of the boat and let it fall off .
44027033	And when day was about to come , Sha’ul urged them all to take food , saying , “ Today is the fourteenth day you have continued without food , and eaten none at all .
44027034	“ So I urge you to take food , for this concerns your safety , since not a hair shall fall from the head of any of you . ”
44027035	And having said this , he took bread and gave thanks to Elohim in the presence of them all . And when he had broken it he began to eat .
44027036	And they were all encouraged , and also took food themselves .
44027037	And all of us were two hundred and seventy-six beings in the ship .
44027038	And being satisfied with food , they were lightening the ship , throwing out the wheat into the sea .
44027039	And when day came , they did not recognise the land , but they noted a certain bay with a beach , onto which they planned to run the ship if possible .
44027040	And having cast off the anchors , they left them in the sea , meanwhile untying the rudder ropes . And they hoisted the foresail to the wind and made for the beach .
44027041	But coming upon a place where two seas met , they grounded the ship , and the prow stuck fast and remained immovable , but the stern was broken by the pounding of the surf .
44027042	And the soldiers intended to kill the prisoners , lest any of them should swim away and escape .
44027043	But the captain , intending to save Sha’ul , kept them from their intention , and commanded those able to swim to jump first and get to land ,
44027044	and the rest , some indeed on boards , and some on items of the ship . And so it came to be that all reached the land in safety .
44028001	And having come to safety , they then learned that the island was called Melite .
44028002	And the foreigners showed us extraordinary kindness , for they kindled a fire and received us all , because of the rain that was falling and because of the cold .
44028003	But Sha’ul , having gathered a bundle of sticks , and having laid them on the fire , an adder came out because of the heat , and fastened itself on his hand .
44028004	And when the foreigners saw the creature hanging from his hand , they said to each other , “ This man is certainly a murderer , whom , though saved from the sea , still right-ruling does not allow to live . ”
44028005	Then , indeed , he shook off the creature into the fire and suffered no evil .
44028006	And expecting that he would swell up or suddenly fall down dead , they waited for a long time and saw no harm come to him , changing their minds they said that he was a mighty one .
44028007	And in the neighbourhood of that place there were lands of the chief of the island , whose name was Poplius , who received us and housed us in a friendly way for three days .
44028008	And it came to be that the father of Poplius lay sick with inflammation and dysentery . Sha’ul went in to him , and having prayed he laid his hands on him and healed him .
44028009	And when this took place , the rest of those on the island who had diseases also came and were healed ,
44028010	who also respected us in many ways . And when we were setting sail , they provided us with our needs .
44028011	And after three months we set sail in an Alexandrian ship which had wintered at the island , and whose figurehead was “ Twin Brothers . ”
44028012	And having landed at Syracuse , we stayed three days ,
44028013	from which place we went round and arrived at Rhegium . And after one day the south wind blew , and the second day we came to Puteoli ,
44028014	where we found brothers , and were invited to stay with them seven days . And so we went toward Rome .
44028015	And when the brothers there heard about us , they came to meet us as far as Forum of Appius and Three Taverns . When Sha’ul saw them , he thanked Elohim and took courage .
44028016	And when we came to Rome , the captain delivered the prisoners to the captain of the guard , but Sha’ul was allowed to stay by himself with the soldier guarding him .
44028017	And it came to be after three days that Sha’ul called the leaders of the Yehuḏim together . And when they had come together , he said to them , “ Men , brothers , though I have done none at all against our people or the practices of our fathers , I was delivered as a prisoner from Yerushalayim into the hands of the Romans ,
44028018	who , when they had examined me , intended to let me go , because there was no cause for putting me to death .
44028019	“ But the Yehuḏim spoke against it , and I was compelled to appeal to Caesar , not that I had any accusation against my nation .
44028020	“ This therefore is the reason I called for you , to see you and speak with you . It is because of the expectation of Yisra’ĕl that I am bound with this chain . ”
44028021	And they said to him , “ We neither received letters from Yehuḏah concerning you , nor have any of the brothers who came reported or spoken whatever wicked about you .
44028022	“ And we think it right to hear from you what you think , for indeed , concerning this sect , we know that it is spoken against everywhere . ”
44028023	And having appointed him a day , many came to him where he was staying , to whom he was explaining , earnestly witnessing about the reign of Elohim , and persuading them concerning יהושע from both the Torah of Mosheh and the Prophets , from morning until evening .
44028024	And some indeed were persuaded by what was said , but some believed not .
44028025	And disagreeing with one another , they began to leave , after Sha’ul had spoken one word , “ The Set-apart Spirit rightly spoke through Yeshayahu the prophet to our fathers ,
44028026	saying , ‘ Go to this people and say , “ Hearing you shall hear but by no means understand , and seeing you shall see but by no means perceive ,
44028027	for the heart of this people has become thickened , and with their ears they heard heavily , and they have closed their eyes , lest they should see with their eyes and hear with their ears , and understand with their heart , and turn back , and I should heal them . ” ’
44028028	“ Therefore let it be known to you that the deliverance of Elohim has been sent to the gentiles , and they shall hear ! ”
44028029	And when he had said these words , the Yehuḏim went away and had a great dispute among themselves .
44028030	And Sha’ul stayed two entire years in his own rented house , and was receiving all who came to him ,
44028031	proclaiming the reign of Elohim and teaching about the Master יהושע Messiah with all boldness , unhindered .
45001001	Sha’ul , a servant of יהושע Messiah , a called emissary , separated to the Good News of Elohim ,
45001002	which He promised before through His prophets in the Set-apart Scriptures ,
45001003	concerning His Son , who came of the seed of Dawiḏ according to the flesh ,
45001004	who was designated Son of Elohim with power , according to the Set-apart Spirit , by the resurrection from the dead : יהושע Messiah , the Master of us ,
45001005	through whom we have received favour and office of the emissary for belief-obedience among all the nations on behalf of His Name ,
45001006	among whom you also are the called ones of יהושע Messiah .
45001007	To all who are in Rome , beloved of Elohim , called , set-apart ones : Favour to you and peace from Elohim our Father and the Master יהושע Messiah .
45001008	First , I truly thank my Elohim through יהושע Messiah for you all , that your belief is spoken of in all the world .
45001009	For Elohim is my witness , whom I serve with my spirit in the Good News of His Son , how unceasingly I make mention of you ,
45001010	always asking in my prayers , if at all possible , I shall be blessed by the desire of Elohim , to come to you .
45001011	For I long to see you , so as to impart some spiritual gift to you , for you to be established ,
45001012	and that is , to be encouraged together among you , each by the other’s belief – both yours and mine .
45001013	And I do not wish you to be unaware , brothers , that I often purposed to come to you , but was hindered until now , in order to have some fruit among you , as also among the other gentiles .
45001014	I am a debtor both to Greeks and to foreigners , both to wise and to foolish .
45001015	That is why I am so eager to bring the Good News also to you who are in Rome .
45001016	For I am not ashamed of the Good News of Messiah , for it is the power of Elohim for deliverance to everyone who believes , to the Yehuḏite first and also to the Greek .
45001017	For in it the righteousness of Elohim is revealed from belief to belief , as it has been written , “ But the righteous shall live by belief . ”
45001018	For the wrath of Elohim is revealed from heaven against all wickedness and unrighteousness of men , who suppress the truth in unrighteousness ,
45001019	because that which is known of Elohim is manifest among them , for Elohim has manifested it to them .
45001020	For since the creation of the world His invisible qualities have been clearly seen , being understood from what has been made , both His everlasting power and Mightiness , for them to be without excuse ,
45001021	because , although they knew Elohim , they did not esteem Him as Elohim , nor gave thanks , but became vain in their reasonings , and their undiscerning heart was darkened .
45001022	Claiming to be wise , they became fools ,
45001023	and changed the esteem of the incorruptible Elohim into the likeness of an image of corruptible man , and of birds and of four-footed beasts and of reptiles .
45001024	Therefore Elohim gave them up to uncleanness in the lust of their hearts , to disrespect their bodies among themselves ,
45001025	who changed the truth of Elohim into the falsehood , and worshipped and served what was created rather than the Creator , who is blessed forever . Amĕn .
45001026	Because of this Elohim gave them over to degrading passions . For even their women exchanged natural relations for what is against nature ,
45001027	and likewise , the men also , having left natural relations with woman , burned in their lust for one another , men with men committing indecency , and receiving back the reward which was due for their straying .
45001028	And even as they did not think it worth- while to possess the knowledge of Elohim , Elohim gave them over to a worthless mind , to do what is improper ,
45001029	having been filled with all unrighteousness , whoring , wickedness , greed , evil ; filled with envy , murder , fighting , deceit , evil habits ; whisperers ,
45001030	slanderers , haters of Elohim , insolent , proud , boasters , devisers of evils , disobedient to parents ,
45001031	without discernment , covenant breakers , unloving , unforgiving , ruthless ;
45001032	who , though they know the righteousness of Elohim , that those who practise such deserve death , not only do the same but also approve of those who practise them .
45002001	Therefore , O man , you are without excuse , everyone who judges , for in which you judge another you condemn yourself , since you who judge practise the same wrongs .
45002002	And we know that the judgment of Elohim is according to truth against those who practise such wrongs .
45002003	And do you think , O man , you who judge those practising such wrongs , and doing the same , that you shall escape the judgment of Elohim ?
45002004	Or do you despise the riches of His kindness , and tolerance , and patience , not knowing that the kindness of Elohim leads you to repentance ?
